channel.title: Java name refactoring - Similar to ZKM?
channel.description:
Hi, was wondering - before I attempt to reinvent the wheel - whether there is anything that works how the ZKM unobfuscate method used to work? I.e. I input a jar file and it renames all fields/methods/classes and dumps the new jar? (Used to rename to aClass anInt aString etc.)
I would like to rename a jar that has been obfuscated with ProGuard (I think). I can't even extract the jar because the names are not valid on a windows OS. Aswell as that they use java keywords as class/method/field names.
I can obviously write something using ASM/BCEL, just wondered if there was something similar knocking around. I have tried searching but there is so much old crap to sift through it's quite difficult.
I tried using an old version of ZKM and the unobfuscate command but it fails. Some kind of class cast exception?

item.title: Java name refactoring - Similar to ZKM?
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Hi, yes I think there is. I’m not too concerned though as I have no major plans with the jar. I am not really going to be decompiling so the flow obfuscation is not such an issue for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Java name refactoring - Similar to ZKM?

item.title: Java name refactoring - Similar to ZKM?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

IIRC theres a pretty heavy flow obfuscation which is the bulk of the obfusication.

Read full topic
